content:
Thanks again Phil for introducing us to Zulip. Sandstorm has now been officially moved to it:

https://sandstorm.org/news/2025-01-29-getting-on-zulip

We've been doing a lot more involved chatting than when we were more active on Matrix. I'm hoping more people will be eager to participate here.
Activity picked up so much. Mostly people from our mailing list I think now that I posted it there. It may be hard to keep track. I don't know how the Rust people do it. We'll see I guess.
This is what I was hoping for though.
Sounds like a mostly good problem to have. :big_smile:

It is. I'm worried about topics going off topic. I was given the go-ahead to reorganize things as they go. But it seems like things are just more organized now with more activity. And people kind of take it upon themselves to organize.
Otherwise it would be a lot for me to deal with.
Yeah, I move messages and whole topics all the time. Keeps things tidy.

So something related to Sandstorm as such:

I released a package for the app ntfy, which handles push notifications. Including, but not only, UnifiedPush.

https://mastodon.social/@ill_logic/114908935871706327
I am hoping to learn how to use the Sandstorm "powerbox" to integrate ntfy in such a way that other Sandstorm apps can connect to it easily and send the user notifications.
Right the thing you were telling me about. Cool. Sounds useful.
